COMMAND.name: show flowcontrol
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display flow control information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use the command to display flowcontrol ability and the pause frame information of each port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to display flowcontrol information: Switch# show flowcontrol eth-0-1
Port Receive FlowControl Send FlowControl RxPause TxPause admin oper admin oper ------------+--------+-----------+--------+---------+------------+----------- eth-0-1 on off on off 0 0

COMMAND.name: flowcontrol
COMMAND.ACTION: if test "${enable}" != "on"; then cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/flowcontrol_${direction}/0 else cdbctl update/cdb/interface/${iface}/flowcontrol_${direction}/1 fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enable or disable flow control send or receive function.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use the flowcontrol Interface Configuration command to set the interfaceâ€™s ability to send or receive pause frames to on or off.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to enable flow control on interface: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# flowcontrol send on
This example shows how to enable flow control on interface: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# flowcontrol receive on
